name: Winged Spindle Tree
climate: The Winged Spindle Tree thrives in temperate climates, requiring cold winters.
In warm regions, this tree may struggle as it needs a period of chilling.
A humid climate may be too intense; cooler conditions are suitable.
It is adapted to regions with distinct seasonal changes for optimal growth.
sunlight: This plant requires full sunlight for most of the day to grow properly.
Partial shade can be tolerated but may affect the vibrancy of the foliage.
Direct sunlight enhances the development of its distinctive red berries.
Inadequate sunlight might lead to leggy growth and sparse flowering.
watering: Consistent watering is necessary, but overwatering should be avoided to prevent root rot.
During dry periods, increase watering frequency to maintain soil moisture.
Waterlogged conditions can harm the plant, necessitating proper drainage.
Reduce watering in winter as the plant enters a dormant phase to conserve water.
soil: The plant prefers well-drained soil that's rich in organic content for nutrients.
Sandy to loamy soil types are ideal, allowing for good root establishment.
It can tolerate slightly acidic to neutral pH levels, aiding nutrient uptake.
Heavy clay soils should be amended to improve aeration and drainage capacity.
toxic: The seeds and berries of the Winged Spindle Tree are toxic if ingested.
Symptoms of ingestion can include nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea.
extra_care_tip: Pruning after flowering helps maintain shape and encourages bushy growth.
Mulching around the base aids moisture retention and suppresses weed growth.
